damaged.description: While this model has 1-5 wounds remaining, each time this model makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

other.name: Assault Ramp
other.description: Each time a unit disembarks from this model after it has made a Normal move, that unit is still eligible to declare a charge this turn.

datasheets.fluff: The Chaos Land Raiders used by the Emperor’s Children are massive armoured transports whose hulls are decorated with the vibrant iconography of Dark God and Legion. These tracked monstrosities purr and thrum with pleasure as they unleash booming volleys of destruction with their array of heavy weapons, stopping only to disgorge bands of warriors into the midst of the fighting.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: 2 soulshatter lascannons; twin heavy bolter; armoured tracks.
datasheets.name: Chaos Land Raider
datasheets.transport: This model has a transport capacity of 14 EMPEROR’S CHILDREN INFANTRY models. Each TERMINATOR and FLAWLESS BLADE model takes up the space of 2 models.
wargear: This model can be equipped with 1 havoc launcher.
This model can be equipped with one of the following: ◦ 1 combi-bolter ◦ 1 combi-weapon

other.name: Lethal Obsession
other.description: In your Shooting phase, each time this unit is selected to shoot, if it makes one or more ranged attacks and all of those attacks target the same enemy unit, until the end of the turn, each time this unit declares a charge, if that enemy unit is a target of that charge, you can re-roll the Charge roll.

datasheets.fluff: Clad in baroque, embossed and gilt Terminator armour, these mighty champions are confident in their superiority, displaying masterful bladework and peerless marksmanship honed by millennia of pitiless slaughter. Their heavy weapons and devastating firepower can spell doom for enemy elite units and war machines alike.
datasheets.loadout: Every model is equipped with: combi-bolter; accursed weapon.
datasheets.name: Chaos Terminators
wargear: 1 model’s accursed weapon can be replaced with 1 chainfist.
Up to 3 models can each have their accursed weapon replaced with 1 power fist.
1 model’s combi-bolter and accursed weapon can be replaced with 1 paired accursed weapons.
Any number of models can each have their combi-bolter replaced with 1 combi-weapon.
1 Chaos Terminator’s combi-bolter can be replaced with one of the following: ◦ 1 heavy flamer ◦ 1 reaper autocannon

other.name: Warped Interference (Psychic)
other.description: While this model is leading a unit, each time a ranged attack targets that unit, models in it have the Benefit of Cover against that attack.

other.name: Wracking Agonies (Psychic)
other.description: In your Shooting phase, after this model has shot, select one INFANTRY unit hit by one or more of those attacks made with its Agonising Energies. Until the start of your next turn, that unit is wracked with agonies. While a unit is wracked with agonies, subtract 2" from its Move characteristic and subtract 2 from Charge rolls made for it.

datasheets.fluff: The Sorcerers of the Emperor’s Children delight in nothing more than toying with their foes. They utilise their fell magicks to inflict nightmarish agonies upon the minds and bodies of the living and to mask the advance of their underlings with illusory misdirection. They delight in each gruesome kill they make, for each is an offering to Slaanesh and promises a reward of power.
datasheets.leader: This model can be attached to the following units: ■ INFRACTORS ■ NOISE MARINES  ■ TORMENTORS
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: Agonising Energies; bolt pistol; force weapon.
datasheets.name: Sorcerer
wargear: None

other.name: Perfectionists
other.description: While this model is leading a unit, weapons equipped by models in that unit have the [LETHAL HITS] ability.

other.name: Euphoric Strikes
other.description: Once per battle, at the start of the Fight phase, this model can use this ability. If it does, until the end of the phase, add 3 to the Attacks characteristic of melee weapons equipped by this model and improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of those weapons by 1.

special.description: If this model is attached to an EMPEROR’S CHILDREN BATTLELINE unit during the Declare Battle Formations step, this model has the Infiltrators and Scouts 6" abilities.
special.name: Lord of the Host

datasheets.fluff: Lords Exultant embody the Emperor’s Children’s obsessive desire to experience new and terrible sensations. Their enhanced forms possess all manner of sensory enhancements, allowing them to experience the thrill of battle on a level that would drive lesser mortals to insanity. With lash and pistol, they lead from the front, slaughtering their foes in exquisitely lurid fashion.
datasheets.leader: This model can be attached to the following units: ■ INFRACTORS ■ TORMENTORS
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: bolt pistol; plasma pistol; Phoenix power spear; close combat weapon.
datasheets.name: Lord Exultant
wargear: This model’s Phoenix power spear can be replaced with one of the following: ◦ 1 master‑crafted power sword  ◦ 1 screamer pistol
This model’s plasma pistol can be replaced with one of the following: ◦ 1 power fist ◦ 1 rapture lash

other.name: Obsessive Annunciation
other.description: While this model is leading a unit, ranged weapons equipped by models in that unit have the [SUSTAINED HITS 1] ability.

other.name: Doom Siren
other.description: In your Shooting phase, after this model’s unit has shot, select one enemy INFANTRY unit hit by one or more of those attacks and roll three D6: for each 4+, that enemy unit suffers 1 mortal wound. If an enemy unit suffers one or more mortal wounds as a result of this ability, it must take a Battle-shock test.

datasheets.fluff: The Lords Kakophonist derive pleasure from auditory stimuli. Such is their singular obsession with emitting lethal sonic destruction that their entire bodies have been agonisingly sculpted to further their art. Leading bands of Noise Marines, these infernal conductors lead an orchestra of discordant and deafening slaughter.
datasheets.leader: This model can be attached to the following units: ■ EMPEROR’S CHILDREN TERMINATOR SQUAD ■ NOISE MARINES
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: screamer pistol; power sword.
datasheets.name: Lord Kakophonist
wargear: This model’s power sword can be replaced with 1 screamer pistol and 1 close combat weapon.

other.name: Scuttling Horrors
other.description: Once per turn, when an enemy unit ends a Normal, Advance or Fall Back move within 9" of this unit, this unit can make a Normal move of up to 6".

datasheets.fluff: For those amongst the Emperor’s Children who fall short of perfection, spawndom awaits. Chaos Spawn of Slaanesh hurl themselves into battle with reckless abandon, quivering with delight as they tear their opponents apart with mutant claws and sinuous tentacles.
datasheets.loadout: Every model is equipped with: hideous mutations.
datasheets.name: Chaos Spawn
wargear: None

other.name: Lord of Excess
other.description: While this model is within 3" of one or more friendly SLAANESH INFANTRY units, this model has the Lone Operative ability.

other.name: Excessive Vigour (Aura)
other.description: While a friendly SLAANESH unit is within 6" of this model, if that unit made a Charge move this turn, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of melee weapons equipped by models in that unit by 1.

other.name: Ecstatic Death
other.description: If this model is destroyed by a melee attack, if it has not fought this phase, roll one D6: on a 2+, do not remove it from play. This model can fight after the attacking unit has finished making its attacks, and is then removed from play.

datasheets.fluff: Possessed of an arrogance borne of infernal power and physical perfection, Daemon Princes of Slaanesh pride themselves upon their martial prowess. Skilled warriors armed with a variety of hellforged weapons, they seek to test themselves against the greatest champions, mortal or otherwise, leaving a tapestry of broken corpses and crimson gore in their wake.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: infernal cannon; hellforged weapons.
datasheets.name: Daemon Prince of Slaanesh
wargear: None

other.name: Terrifying Crescendo
other.description: In your Shooting phase, after this unit has shot, select one enemy unit hit by one or more of those attacks. Until the start of your next Shooting phase, each time a Battle-shock or Leadership test is taken for that enemy unit, subtract 1 from that test.

datasheets.fluff: Orchestrating riotous destruction on large scales, Noise Marines saturate the war zone with piercing bursts of shattering noise, thrumming waves of aural destruction and other extreme psychosonic attacks. These hedonistic worshippers of Slaanesh are inured to most stimuli and seek to unleash the most cacophonous destruction to stir their jaded senses.
datasheets.loadout: Every model is equipped with: sonic blaster; close combat weapon.
datasheets.name: Noise Marines
wargear: Up to 2 Noise Marines can each replace their sonic blaster with 1 blastmaster.
The Disharmonist’s sonic blaster can be replaced with 1 screamer pistol and 1 power sword.

other.name: Objective Defiled
other.description: At the end of your Command phase, if this unit is within range of an objective marker you control, that objective marker remains under your control until your opponent’s Level of Control over that objective marker is greater than yours at the end of a phase.

wargear.name: Icon of Excess
wargear.description: At the end of your Shooting phase or the Fight phase, if the bearer’s unit destroyed one or more enemy units that phase, the bearer’s unit takes a Leadership test. If that test is passed, you gain 1CP.

datasheets.fluff: Clad in garish power armour and clutching over‑ornamented boltguns, Tormentors form the core of many Emperor’s Children warbands. Consumed by ego and desire, Tormentors are aggressive front‑line troops who prioritise aggression and speed, always seeking new and greater experiences and revelling in the gory deaths they inflict upon their enemies.
datasheets.loadout:
The Obsessionist is equipped with: bolt pistol; power sword.
Every Tormentor is equipped with: boltgun; close combat weapon.
datasheets.name: Tormentors
wargear: 1 Tormentor can be equipped with 1 icon of excess.
For every 5 models in this unit, 1 Tormentor’s boltgun can be replaced with 1 plasma gun.
For every 5 models in this unit, 1 Tormentor’s boltgun can be replaced with 1 meltagun.
The Obsessionist’s power sword can be replaced with 1 rapture lash.
The Obsessionist’s bolt pistol can be replaced with 1 plasma pistol.

other.name: Assault Vehicle
other.description: Units can disembark from this TRANSPORT after it has Advanced. Units that do so count as having made a Normal move, and cannot declare a charge that turn.

datasheets.fluff: Eager and impetuous of spirit, Emperor’s Children Chaos Rhinos roar with barely contained anticipation as they thunder into the midst of battle to unload their cargo of warriors. Their garishly adorned hulls quiver with a perverse thrill in response to each impact upon their reinforced hulls as pintle‑mounted guns unleash spiteful volleys of destruction into the ranks of the enemy.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: combi-bolter; armoured tracks.
datasheets.name: Chaos Rhino
datasheets.transport: This model has a transport capacity of 12 EMPEROR’S CHILDREN INFANTRY models (excluding TERMINATOR and FLAWLESS BLADE models).
wargear: This model can be equipped with 1 havoc launcher or can replace 1 combi-bolter with 1 havoc launcher.
This model can be equipped with one of the following: ◦ 1 combi-bolter ◦ 1 combi-weapon

other.name: Daemonic Destruction
other.description: Each time this model ends a Charge move, select one enemy unit within Engagement Range of it and roll one D6 for each of this model’s remaining wounds: for each 4+, that enemy unit suffers 1 mortal wound (to a maximum of 6 mortal wounds).

other.name: Stimulated by Pain
other.description: Each time an attack is allocated to this model, subtract 1 from the Damage characteristic of that attack.

composition: 1 Daemon Prince of Slaanesh with Wings
datasheets.fluff: Only the most debased, conceited and skilled warriors of the Emperor’s Children achieve daemonhood. Of these, a scant few are blessed with winged daemonic forms that enhance their already potent destructive power and open them to sensation beyond the ken of mortal minds. Thus do they eagerly seek battle, longing to inflict and experience the most exquisite of agonies.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: infernal cannon; hellforged weapons.
datasheets.name: Daemon Prince of Slaanesh with Wings

stats.name: Daemon Prince of Slaanesh with Wings

wargear: None

damaged.description: While this model has 1‑6 wounds remaining, each time this model makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

other.name: Daemonic Poisons
other.description: In your Shooting phase and the Fight phase, after this model has finished making its attacks, select one enemy unit hit by one or more of those attacks. Until the end of the battle, that enemy unit is poisoned. At the start of each player’s Command phase, roll one D6 for each poisoned enemy unit on the battlefield: on a 4+, that enemy unit suffers D3 mortal wounds.

other.name: Daemon Primarch of Slaanesh
other.description: At the start of your opponent’s Command phase, select one of the abilities in the Daemon Primarch of Slaanesh section (see below). Until the start of your opponent’s next Command phase, this model has that ability.

abilities.name: Beguiling Form
abilities.description: Each time a model makes an attack that targets this model, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

abilities.name: Daemonic Speed
abilities.description: This model has the Fights First ability.

abilities.name: Enthralling Hypnosis (Aura)
abilities.description: While an enemy unit is within 6" of this model, each time that unit is selected to Fall Back, it must take a Leadership test. If that test is failed, that unit must Remain Stationary this phase instead.

special.description: If this model is in your army, it must be your WARLORD.
special.name: Supreme Commander

datasheets.fluff: Fulgrim embodies the depravity and corruption of his once‑noble Legion. His sinuous serpentine form towers over the battlefield and moves with quicksilver speed, lashing whip and thrashing tail scattering those beguiled by the grotesque magnificence of his daemonic form. Any who possess the wherewithal to resist the Daemon Primarch’s stupefying aura are cut down with casual ease.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: malefic lash; daemonic blades; serpentine tail.
datasheets.name: Fulgrim
wargear: None

other.name: A Challenge Worthy of Skill
other.description: Each time this model makes an attack that targets a CHARACTER, MONSTER or WALKER unit, you can re-roll the Hit roll and you can re-roll the Wound roll.

other.name: Duellist’s Hubris
other.description: At the start of the Fight phase, if this model is not leading a unit, until the end of the phase, it has the Fights First ability.

datasheets.fluff: An arrogant slaughterer and swordmaster supreme, Lucius seeks out the most skilled of the foe’s champions, casually striking down lesser enemies that dare bar his path. Against worthy opponents, Lucius strikes with the speed of a snake, his daemonically sentient lash and blade making a mockery of the greatest warriors.
datasheets.leader: This model can be attached to the following units: ■ FLAWLESS BLADES
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: Blade of the Laer; Lash of Torment.
datasheets.name: Lucius the Eternal
wargear: None

damaged.description: While this model has 1-4 wounds remaining, each time this model makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

other.name: Airborne Predator
other.description: Each time this model ends a Normal move, you can select one enemy unit that it moved over during that move and roll two D6, adding 1 to each result if that enemy unit can FLY: for each 4+, that enemy unit suffers D3 mortal wounds.

datasheets.fluff: The dragon-like Daemon Engines known as Heldrakes soar above the battlefield, engaging in furious duels with enemy aircraft. They pick their foes apart with obsessive precision and malicious glee. Should the sky be cleared of victims, Heldrakes immediately direct their ire towards those on the ground, descending at breakneck speed to slaughter the enemy with weapon and claw.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: Hades autocannon; Heldrake claws.
datasheets.name: Heldrake
wargear: This model’s Hades autocannon can be replaced with 1 baleflamer.

other.name: Excessive Assault
other.description: Each time a model in this unit targets an enemy unit with a melee attack, re-roll a Wound roll of 1. If that enemy unit is within range of an objective marker, you can re-roll the Wound roll instead.

wargear.name: Icon of Excess
wargear.description: At the end of your Shooting phase or the Fight phase, if the bearer’s unit destroyed one or more enemy units that phase, the bearer’s unit takes a Leadership test. If that test is passed, you gain 1CP.

datasheets.fluff: Consumed by an obsessive desire to experience sensation in all its forms, Infractors hurl themselves upon the foe with ecstatic glee. Their veins thick with an esoteric cocktail of combat stimms, they are formidable and relentlessly cruel combatants.
datasheets.loadout:
The Obsessionist is equipped with: bolt pistol; power sword.
Every Infractor is equipped with: bolt pistol; duelling sabre.
datasheets.name: Infractors
wargear: 1 Infractor can be equipped with 1 icon of excess.
The Obsessionist’s power sword can be replaced with 1 rapture lash.
The Obsessionist’s bolt pistol can be replaced with 1 plasma pistol

damaged.description: While this model has 1-4 wounds remaining, each time this model makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

other.name: Glutton for Punishment
other.description: Each time this model makes an attack, if it is below its Starting Strength, add 1 to the Hit roll. If this model is also Below Half-strength, add 1 to the Wound roll as well.

datasheets.fluff: The Maulerfiends of the Emperor’s Children possess a ravenous appetite for carnage and are empowered by the agonies inflicted upon them. They charge recklessly into the thick of the fighting, howling with pleasure as they tear infantry apart and reduce fortifications and vehicles to molten rubble with their fists or glowing magma cutters.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: lasher tendrils; Maulerfiend fists.
datasheets.name: Maulerfiend
wargear: This model’s lasher tendrils can be replaced with 2 magma cutters.

other.name: Daemonic Patrons
other.description: Each time this unit is selected to fight, it can call upon daemonic patrons. If it does, until the end of the phase, each time a model in this unit makes an attack, an unmodified Wound roll of 3+ scores a Critical Wound. At the end of the Fight phase, if this unit called upon daemonic patrons this phase and no enemy models were destroyed by attacks made by models in this unit this phase, one model in this unit is destroyed.

datasheets.fluff: These cruel and arrogant warriors are consumed by pride in their own skill at arms. Granted power by daemonic patrons, the Flawless Blades strive to entertain their malefic masters with superlative swordplay and by inflicting vile and visceral death upon their foes.
datasheets.loadout: Every model is equipped with: bolt pistol; blissblade.
datasheets.name: Flawless Blades
wargear: None

enhancements.name: Steeped in Suffering
enhancements.description: EMPEROR’S CHILDREN model only. Each time a model in the bearer’s unit makes an attack that targets an enemy unit below its Starting Strength, add 1 to the Hit roll. If that target is also Below Half-strength, add 1 to the Wound roll as well.

enhancements.name: Intoxicating Musk
enhancements.description: EMPEROR’S CHILDREN model only. Each time a melee attack targets the bearer’s unit, if the Strength characteristic of that attack is greater than the Toughness characteristic of that unit, subtract 1 from the Wound roll.

enhancements.name: Tactical Perfection
enhancements.description: EMPEROR’S CHILDREN model only. After both players have deployed their armies, select up to two EMPEROR’S CHILDREN units from your army and redeploy them. When doing so, you can set those units up in Strategic Reserves if you wish, regardless of how many units are already in Strategic Reserves.

enhancements.name: Loathsome Dexterity
enhancements.description: EMPEROR’S CHILDREN model only. Each time a model in the bearer’s unit makes a Normal, Advance or Fall Back move, it can move through enemy models. When doing so, it can move within Engagement Range of such models but cannot end that move within Engagement Range of them, and any Desperate Escape test is automatically passed.

enhancements.name: Faultless Opportunist
enhancements.description: EMPEROR’S CHILDREN model only. You can target the bearer’s unit with the Heroic Intervention Stratagem for 0CP, and can do so even if you have already targeted a different unit with that Stratagem this phase.

enhancements.name: Blinding Speed
enhancements.description: EMPEROR’S CHILDREN model only. Once per battle, at the start of the Fight phase, the bearer can use this Enhancement. If it does, until the end of the phase, models in the bearer’s unit have the Fights First ability.

enhancements.name: Distortion
enhancements.description: EMPEROR’S CHILDREN model only. Add 1 to the Attacks and Damage characteristics of melee weapons equipped by the bearer.

enhancements.name: Rise to the Challenge
enhancements.description: EMPEROR’S CHILDREN INFANTRY model only. Once per battle, at the end of the Fight phase, if the bearer is within Engagement Range of three or more enemy models, it can use this Enhancement. If it does, the bearer can fight one additional time. When doing so, you can select one ability using the Exquisite Swordsmanship Detachment rule to apply to those attacks.

enhancements.name: Sublime Prescience
enhancements.description: EMPEROR’S CHILDREN INFANTRY model only. Once per turn, in your Movement phase, the bearer can use this Enhancement. If it does, select one friendly EMPEROR’S CHILDREN TRANSPORT that is in Strategic Reserves. Until the end of the phase, for the purposes of setting up that TRANSPORT on the battlefield, treat the current battle round number as being one higher than it actually is.

enhancements.name: Spearhead Striker
enhancements.description: EMPEROR’S CHILDREN INFANTRY model only. Each time the bearer disembarks from a TRANSPORT, until the end of the turn, you can re-roll Charge rolls made for the bearer’s unit and enemy units cannot use the Fire Overwatch Stratagem to shoot at the bearer’s unit.

enhancements.name: Accomplished Tactician
enhancements.description: EMPEROR’S CHILDREN INFANTRY model only. Once per turn, in your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has shot, you can select one friendly EMPEROR’S CHILDREN unit within 9" of the bearer that was hit by one or more of those attacks, then select one friendly TRANSPORT that unit is wholly within 6" of and is able to embark within. That EMPEROR’S CHILDREN unit can embark within that TRANSPORT.

enhancements.name: Heretek Adept
enhancements.description: EMPEROR’S CHILDREN INFANTRY model only. Once per battle round, when a saving throw is failed for a friendly EMPEROR’S CHILDREN VEHICLE model within 6" of the bearer, you can change the Damage characteristic of that attack to 0.

enhancements.name: Empyric Suffusion
enhancements.description: EMPEROR’S CHILDREN model only. Once per battle round, you can target one friendly SLAANESH unit within 6" of the bearer with the Heroic Intervention Stratagem for 0CP.

enhancements.name: Dark Blessings
enhancements.description: EMPEROR’S CHILDREN INFANTRY model only. Once per battle, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets, the bearer can use this Enhancement. If it does, until the end of the phase, the bearer has a 3+ invulnerable save.

enhancements.name: Possessed Blade
enhancements.description: EMPEROR’S CHILDREN model only. At the start of the battle, select one melee weapon equipped by the bearer; add 1 to the Attacks characteristic of that weapon. In addition, each time the bearer is selected to fight, it can use this Enhancement. If it does, while resolving those attacks, add 1 to the Damage characteristic of that weapon and that weapon has the [DEVASTATING WOUNDS] and [HAZARDOUS] abilities.

enhancements.name: Warp Walker
enhancements.description: EMPEROR’S CHILDREN or KEEPER OF SECRETS model only. Each time the bearer’s unit Advances, do not make an Advance roll. Instead, until the end of the phase, add 6" to the Move characteristic of models in that unit. Each time a model in the bearer’s unit makes a Normal, Advance or Fall Back move, it can move through enemy models. When doing so, it can move within Engagement Range of such models but cannot end that move within Engagement Range of them, and any Desperate Escape test is automatically passed.

enhancements.name: Pledge to Eternal Servitude
enhancements.description: EMPEROR’S CHILDREN model only. The first time the bearer is destroyed, take a Leadership test for the bearer at the end of the phase. If that test is passed, set the bearer back up on the battlefield, as close as possible to where it was destroyed and not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units, with D6 wounds remaining (up to its Wounds characteristic).

enhancements.name: Pledge of Dark Glory
enhancements.description: EMPEROR’S CHILDREN model only. While the bearer is leading a unit, improve the Leadership and Objective Control characteristics of models in that unit by 1.

enhancements.name: Pledge of Mortal Pain
enhancements.description: EMPEROR’S CHILDREN model only. At the start of your Shooting phase, select one enemy unit within 12" of and visible to the bearer. That unit must take a Leadership test, subtracting 2 from the result if it is Battle-shocked: if failed, that enemy unit suffers 3 mortal wounds.

enhancements.name: Pledge of Unholy Fortune
enhancements.description: EMPEROR’S CHILDREN model only. Once per turn, just after making a Hit roll, a Wound roll or a saving throw for a model in the bearer’s unit, if the bearer is not Battle-shocked, it can use this Enhancement. If it does, treat the result as an unmodified roll of 6 instead.

enhancements.name: Eager to Prove
enhancements.description: EMPEROR’S CHILDREN model only. You can re-roll Charge rolls made for the bearer’s unit. While the bearer’s unit is your army’s Favoured Champions, add 2" to the Move characteristic of models in that unit.

enhancements.name: Repulsed by Weakness
enhancements.description: EMPEROR’S CHILDREN model only. Each time an enemy unit (excluding MONSTERS and VEHICLES) within Engagement Range of the bearer’s unit Falls Back, models in that enemy unit must take Desperate Escape tests. When doing so, if the bearer’s unit is your army’s Favoured Champions, subtract 1 from each of those Desperate Escape tests.

enhancements.name: Proud and Vainglorious
enhancements.description: EMPEROR’S CHILDREN model only. You can re-roll Battle-shock and Leadership tests taken for the bearer’s unit. While the bearer’s unit is your army’s Favoured Champions, add 1 to the Objective Control characteristic of models in that unit.

enhancements.name: Slayer of Champions
enhancements.description: EMPEROR’S CHILDREN model only. The bearer’s melee weapons have the [PRECISION] ability, and each time the bearer makes a melee attack that targets a CHARACTER unit, improve the Strength and Armour Penetration characteristics of that attack by 1.

rule.text: This ability is described in full in the Army Rules section of *Codex: Chaos Space Marines*.

When mustering your army, you can select **EMPEROR’S CHILDREN** as your Army Faction. If you do:

■ Your army must include **LUCIUS THE ETERNAL**, and that model must be your **WARLORD**.
■ **LUCIUS THE ETERNAL** and **NOISE MARINES** units from your army gain the **HERETIC ASTARTES** Faction keyword.
■ You can include **HERETIC ASTARTES** units in your army (excluding **KHORNE**, **NURGLE** and **TZEENTCH** units), even though they do not have the **EMPEROR’S CHILDREN** Faction keyword.
■ For the purposes of the Dark Pacts ability (see Codex: Chaos Space Marines), your Army Faction is still considered to be **HERETIC ASTARTES**.
■ In the Select Detachment Rules step, you can select a Detachment from Codex: Chaos Space Marines. If you select the Pactbound Zealots Detachment, each time you select a keyword for a **HERETIC ASTARTES** unit to gain as a result of the Marks of Chaos rule, you must select **SLAANESH**.
■ Each time you select a keyword for a **DAEMON PRINCE** or **DAEMON PRINCE WITH WINGS** model to gain as a result of the Daemonic Allegiance rule, you must select **SLAANESH**.

stratagems.name: Devoted Duellists
stratagems.target: One or more EMPEROR’S CHILDREN CHARACTER units from your army that have not been selected to fight this phase.
stratagems.when: Fight phase.
stratagems.effect: Select one enemy unit. Until the end of the phase, melee weapons equipped by models in those CHARACTER units have the [SUSTAINED HITS 1] ability while targeting that enemy unit.
stratagems.fluff: By slaying their foes in close combat, the champions of Slaanesh seek to elevate themselves in his favour.

stratagems.name: Heightened Jealousy
stratagems.target: Your army’s Favoured Champions unit.
stratagems.when: Your Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an EMPEROR’S CHILDREN CHARACTER unit becomes your army’s Favoured Champions, or just after your army’s Favoured Champions unit destroys an enemy unit.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in an EMPEROR’S CHILDREN CHARACTER unit from your army that is not your army’s Favoured Champions makes an attack, add 1 to the Strength characteristic of that attack.
stratagems.fluff: Rivalries are commonplace amongst the champions of the Emperor’s Children as all vie for Slaanesh’s boons.

stratagems.name: Refusal to be Outdone
stratagems.target: One EMPEROR’S CHILDREN CHARACTER unit from your army.
stratagems.when: Your Charge phase.
stratagems.effect: Select one enemy unit within Engagement Range of one or more units from your army. Until the end of the phase, each time your unit declares a charge, if that enemy unit is one of the targets of that charge, add 2 to the Charge roll.
stratagems.fluff: Rivals for the Dark Prince’s favour will stop at nothing to outdo their foes and claim a greater tally of souls.

stratagems.name: Sustained by Agony
stratagems.target: That EMPEROR’S CHILDREN unit.
stratagems.when: Fight phase, just after an EMPEROR’S CHILDREN unit from your army destroys an enemy unit.
stratagems.effect: Select one friendly LEGIONS OF EXCESS unit within 6" of your unit. One model in that LEGIONS OF EXCESS unit recovers up to 3 lost wounds or, if it is a DAEMONETTES unit, return up to D3+3 destroyed models to it instead.
stratagems.fluff: Slaaneshi daemons feed upon the emotions of others, with agony a particular delicacy.

stratagems.name: Sycophantic Surge
stratagems.target: One LEGIONS OF EXCESS unit from your army.
stratagems.when: Your Charge phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, your unit is eligible to declare a charge in a turn in which it Advanced or Fell Back, provided at least one of the targets of that charge is within Engagement Range of one or more EMPEROR’S CHILDREN units from your army.
stratagems.fluff: The daemons of Slaanesh care naught for mortals but strive to earn the approval of their Dark Prince.

stratagems.name: Uncanny Reactions
stratagems.target: One SLAANESH unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets your unit, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.
stratagems.fluff: Those who have earned the favour of their Dark Prince may be granted a sliver of his grace.

stratagems.name: Cruel Bladesman
stratagems.target: One EMPEROR’S CHILDREN unit from your army that made a Charge move this turn and has not been selected to fight this phase.
stratagems.when: Fight phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of melee weapons equipped by models in your unit by 1.
stratagems.fluff: Fulgrim’s scions are renowned for their bladecraft, toying with their inferiors while preparing an exquisite, penetrating thrust.

stratagems.name: Deft Parry
stratagems.target: One EMPEROR’S CHILDREN unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
stratagems.when: Fight phase just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets your unit, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.
stratagems.fluff: Bedazzled by these warriors’ weaving swordsmanship and hypnotic aura foes cannot land a telling blow upon them.

stratagems.name: Incessant Violence
stratagems.target: That EMPEROR’S CHILDREN unit.
stratagems.when: Fight phase, just before an EMPEROR’S CHILDREN unit from your army Consolidates.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes a Consolidation move, it can move up to 6" instead of up to 3", provided your unit ends that Consolidation move within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.
stratagems.fluff: Caught up in the joyful exhilaration of violent excess, the momentum of the Emperor’s Children is almost impossible to halt.

stratagems.name: Violent Excess
stratagems.target: One EMPEROR’S CHILDREN unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
stratagems.when: Fight phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, melee weapons equipped by models in your unit have the [SUSTAINED HITS 1] ability.
stratagems.fluff: The visceral thrill of killing causes the warriors of the Emperor’s Children to enter an ecstatic frenzy of butchery and dismemberment.

stratagems.name: Honour the Prince
stratagems.target: One EMPEROR’S CHILDREN INFANTRY unit from your army that has not been selected to move this phase.
stratagems.when: Your Movement phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, if your unit Advances, do not make an Advance roll. Instead, until the end of the phase, add 6" to the Move characteristic of models in your unit.
stratagems.fluff: Warriors who venerate Slaanesh through the most graceful fighting forms are rewarded for their efforts.

stratagems.name: Capricious Reactions
stratagems.target: One EMPEROR’S CHILDREN unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets your unit, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.
stratagems.fluff: Their superhuman reflexes enhanced by endless streams of addictive combat stimms, the Emperor’s Children react to incoming fire with haste, weaving between shots and taking cover in the blink of an eye.

stratagems.name: Martial Perfection
stratagems.target: One EMPEROR’S CHILDREN unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
stratagems.when: Fight phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack, you can re-roll the Hit roll.
stratagems.fluff: The Emperor’s Children find stimulation in excess, be it brutally shocking acts of violence or gratuitous displays of martial prowess.

stratagems.name: Combat Stimms
stratagems.target: One EMPEROR’S CHILDREN INFANTRY unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
stratagems.when: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets your unit, subtract 1 from the Wound roll.
stratagems.fluff: Hideously euphoric concoctions empower the minds and constitutions of the Legion’s sybaritic warriors.

stratagems.name: Diabolic Majesty
stratagems.target: That EMPEROR’S CHILDREN unit.
stratagems.when: Your Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an EMPEROR’S CHILDREN CHARACTER unit becomes your army’s Favoured Champions.
stratagems.effect: Each enemy unit within 6" of your unit must take a Battle-shock test, subtracting 1 from the result.
stratagems.restrictions: You can only use this Stratagem once per battle round.
stratagems.fluff: Those who gaze upon one of Slaanesh’s chosen are stricken by their diabolic majesty.

stratagems.name: Dynamic Breakthrough
stratagems.target: One EMPEROR’S CHILDREN VEHICLE unit from your army that has not been selected to move this phase.
stratagems.when: Your Movement phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes a move, it can move through enemy models (excluding MONSTERS and VEHICLES). When doing so, it can move within Engagement Range of such models but cannot end that move within Engagement Range of them, and any Desperate Escape test is automatically passed
stratagems.fluff: Relying upon shock, awe and daemonically enhanced vehicles, the Emperor’s Children drive through the enemy lines to outflank the enemy.

stratagems.name: Unshakeable Opponents
stratagems.target: One EMPEROR’S CHILDREN unit from your army.
stratagems.when: Command phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the turn, each time a model in your unit makes an attack, you can ignore any or all modifiers to the following: that attack’s Ballistic Skill or Weapon Skill characteristic; the Hit roll; the Wound roll.
stratagems.fluff: Inured to ordinary sensations by several lifetimes of indulgence, there is little that can deter or faze the warriors of the Emperor’s Children.

stratagems.name: Unbound Arrogance
stratagems.target: That EMPEROR’S CHILDREN unit.
stratagems.when: Your Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an EMPEROR’S CHILDREN unit from your army destroys an enemy unit.
stratagems.effect: Increase your pledge to Slaanesh by 1.
stratagems.restrictions: You can only use this Stratagem once per battle round.
stratagems.fluff: The hubris of the Emperor’s Children is both their greatest strength and their biggest weakness.

stratagems.name: Beautiful Death
stratagems.target: One EMPEROR’S CHILDREN CHARACTER unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
stratagems.when: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit is destroyed, if that model has not fought this phase, roll one D6, adding 1 to the result if your unit is your army’s Favoured Champions. On a 4+, do not remove the destroyed model from play; it can fight after the attacking unit has finished making its attacks, and is then removed from play.
stratagems.fluff: The more extravagant and luridly violent the kill, the greater the Dark Prince’s appreciation.

stratagems.name: Vengeful Surge
stratagems.target: One EMPEROR’S CHILDREN CHARACTER unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
stratagems.effect: After the attacking unit has shot, your unit can make a Surge move. To do so, roll one D6: each model in your unit can move a distance in inches up to the result, but your unit must end that move as close as possible to the closest enemy unit. When doing so, those models can be moved within Engagement Range of that enemy unit. If your unit is not your army’s Favoured Champions, you can re-roll the dice to determine the distance of its Surge move.
stratagems.fluff: Consumed by their obsessive desire for revenge, the Emperor’s Children surge into oncoming fusillades.

stratagems.name: Ecstatic Slaughter
stratagems.target: That LEGIONS OF EXCESS unit and one friendly EMPEROR’S CHILDREN unit within 6" of it that is not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.
stratagems.when: Fight phase, just after a LEGIONS OF EXCESS unit from your army destroys an enemy unit.
stratagems.effect: Your EMPEROR’S CHILDREN unit can declare a charge. If it does so and it has already been selected to fight this phase, it cannot fight again this phase.
stratagems.fluff: As the violence intensifies, so does the ecstasy of battle empower daemon and mortal alike.

stratagems.name: Terrifying Spectacle
stratagems.target: One EMPEROR’S CHILDREN unit from your army that made a Charge move in the previous turn and destroyed one or more enemy units in the previous Fight phase.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Command phase.
stratagems.effect: Each enemy unit within 6" of your unit must take a Battle-shock test, subtracting 1 from that test if they are Below Half-strength. Enemy units affected by this Stratagem do not need to take any other Battle-shock tests in the same phase.
stratagems.fluff: Flensing strikes, dismemberments and eviscerations strike fear into the hearts of the foe.

stratagems.name: On to the Next
stratagems.target: One EMPEROR’S CHILDREN unit from your army that destroyed an enemy unit this phase, and one friendly TRANSPORT it is able to embark within.
stratagems.when: End of the Fight phase.
stratagems.effect: If your EMPEROR’S CHILDREN unit is wholly within 6" of that TRANSPORT, it can embark within it.
stratagems.fluff: The fleeting obsessions of the Emperor’s Children cause them always to seek fresh targets.

stratagems.name: Advance and Claim
stratagems.target: One EMPEROR’S CHILDREN TRANSPORT from your army that has one or more TORMENTORS units embarked within it (excluding Battle-shocked units).
stratagems.when: Your Command phase.
stratagems.effect: Select one objective marker you control that your TRANSPORT is within range of. That objective marker remains under your control until your opponent’s Level of Control over that objective marker is greater than yours at the end of a phase.
stratagems.fluff: The Emperor’s Children send forth their front-line troops in swift vehicles to seize ground rapidly.

stratagems.name: Ceaseless Onslaught
stratagems.target: One EMPEROR’S CHILDREN unit from your army that disembarked from a TRANSPORT that made a Normal move this turn.
stratagems.when: Your Charge phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, your EMPEROR’S CHILDREN unit is eligible to declare a charge.
stratagems.fluff: Cocktails of combat stimms and a blazing murderlust drive the warriors of the Emperor’s Children forward at breakneck speed.

stratagems.name: Reactive Disembarkation
stratagems.target: One EMPEROR’S CHILDREN TRANSPORT from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
stratagems.effect: One EMPEROR’S CHILDREN unit embarked within your TRANSPORT can disembark. When doing so, models in that unit can be set up anywhere on the battlefield wholly within 6" of that TRANSPORT and not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.
stratagems.fluff: As their transports come under fire, the Emperor’s Children disembark and take the fight to the foe with boltgun and sword.

stratagems.name: Outflanking Strike
stratagems.target: One EMPEROR’S CHILDREN TRANSPORT from your army, or up to two EMPEROR’S CHILDREN DEDICATED TRANSPORTS from your army.
stratagems.when: End of your opponent’s Fight phase.
stratagems.effect: For each of those TRANSPORTS wholly within 9" of one or more battlefield edges, remove it from the battlefield and place it into Strategic Reserves.
stratagems.fluff: The Emperor’s Children utilise their infantry to pin the enemy down whilst further transports seek to outflank the foe and deploy troops behind.

stratagems.name: Dark Vigour
stratagems.target: One EMPEROR’S CHILDREN unit from your army (excluding BEASTS and VEHICLES) that is within 9" of the enemy unit that just ended that move.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Movement phase, just after an enemy unit ends a Normal, Advance or Fall Back move.
stratagems.effect: Your unit can make a Normal move of up to 6".
stratagems.fluff: The Emperor’s Children possess inhuman vigour - their warriors move with monstrous speed to counter any advance and meet any challenge.

stratagems.name: Cruel Raiders
stratagems.target: One EMPEROR’S CHILDREN unit from your army that is wholly within 9" of one or more battlefield edges and not within 3" horizontally of one or more enemy units.
stratagems.when: End of your opponent’s Fight phase.
stratagems.effect: Remove your unit from the battlefield and place it into Strategic Reserves.
stratagems.fluff: The Emperor’s Children delight in the shattering of false hope, often disengaging from their foes only to strike again at an exposed flank.

stratagems.name: Protection of the Dark Prince
stratagems.target: That EMPEROR’S CHILDREN unit.
stratagems.when: Any phase, just after a mortal wound or attack is allocated to a model in an EMPEROR’S CHILDREN unit from your army.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, models in your unit have the Feel No Pain 6+ ability, and the Feel No Pain 4+ ability against mortal wounds.
stratagems.fluff: On occasion, the Dark Prince may grant a boon of protection to his favoured followers in the heat of battle. Such a boon incurs a debt, one that will be paid in the fullness of time.

stratagems.name: Embrace the Pain
stratagems.target: One EMPEROR’S CHILDREN INFANTRY unit from your army.
stratagems.when: Start of the Fight phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time an enemy model within Engagement Range of your unit selects targets, it must select your unit as the target of its attacks.
stratagems.fluff: The Emperor’s Children revel in every sensation - even ones that would slay lesser mortals outright.

stratagems.name: Violent Crescendo
stratagems.target: One SLAANESH BEASTS, SLAANESH INFANTRY or SLAANESH MOUNTED unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
stratagems.when: Fight phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes a Pile-in or Consolidation move, it can move up to 6" instead of up to 3". When doing so, it does not need to end that move closer to the closest enemy model, provided it ends that move as close as possible to the closest enemy unit.
stratagems.fluff: In the final act of the battle, the followers of Slaanesh descend to slaughter the remaining foes.

stratagems.name: Dark Apparitions
stratagems.target: One DAEMONETTES unit from your army that is not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.
stratagems.when: End of your opponent’s Fight phase.
stratagems.effect: Remove your unit from the battlefield and place it into Strategic Reserves. If it arrives back on the battlefield in the Reinforcements step of your next Movement phase using the Deep Strike ability, it can be set up anywhere that is more than 6" horizontally away from all enemy units (instead of more than 9"). provided it is also set up wholly within 9" of one or more friendly EMPEROR’S CHILDREN units.
stratagems.fluff: The daemons of Slaanesh are not bound by the laws of reality, fading in and out of existence at will.

stratagems.name: Cut Down the Weak
stratagems.target: One EMPEROR’S CHILDREN unit from your army (you can only select a VEHICLE if it is a WALKER) that is within 6" of that enemy unit and would be eligible to declare a charge against that enemy unit if it were your Charge phase.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Movement phase, just after an enemy unit Falls Back.
stratagems.effect: Your unit can declare a charge. When doing so, you must select that enemy unit as a target of that charge, and your unit does not receive a Charge bonus this turn.
stratagems.fluff: Contempt for lesser warriors drives the Emperor’s Children in their punishing reprisals.

stratagems.name: Death Ecstasy
stratagems.target: One EMPEROR’S CHILDREN unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
stratagems.when: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit is destroyed, if that model has not fought this phase, do not remove it from play. The destroyed model can fight after the attacking unit has finished making its attacks, and is then removed from play.
stratagems.fluff: Death is but another thrilling experience and the Emperor’s Children are loath to deny the enemy such ecstatic sensation.

stratagems.name: Armour of Abhorrence
stratagems.target: One EMPEROR’S CHILDREN unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack is allocated to a model in your unit, worsen the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.
stratagems.fluff: The abhorrent contempt that the Emperor’s Children possess, combined with their combat-stimmed physiologies, makes them unyielding foes to face.
